column4: hi! everybody .... when i run "uptime" in terminal i get 3 user despite i am the only user in the system! ..... does that mean there is an intrusion!!??
plz! can anybody help me here?!
hi! everybody .... when i run "uptime" in terminal i get 3 user despite i am the only user in the system! ..... does that mean there is an intrusion!!??
Do you have more than one terminal open?
: sorry! :) u r right ... i had two terminal open ... but i still have 2 users ... is it like me (user) and root?!!
Probably because sudo hasn't worn off yet.
: sorry! i am new to linux! ... what did u mean by "not worn yet"?
When you do 'sudo something' then it caches your password.  For about 15 minutes.  If you sudo again for 15 minutes you will not be asked your password.  I think this is causing root to show up.
: i ran "sudo su" but still!!! ... is it normal!!
what?  sudo su would log you in as root
: yea! i thought if i log in as root it will show only 1 user!
It would show root...  It will show at least two users if you're using a GUI one for the gui and one for the bash shell you're using to run who or uptime or whatever
: malamber : thanks ! :) i think i got it now! :) cheers!
: what i got "it's ok" ... that's enough for me! :) lolz thanks again!
